thread.title: Dottie Pepper back to full-time golf broadcasting with CBS
thread.title_full: Dottie Pepper back to full-time golf broadcasting with CBS

author: DOUG FERGUSON
title: Dottie Pepper back to full-time golf broadcasting with CBS
text:
Dottie Pepper back to full-time golf broadcasting with CBS Associated Press 3 hrs ago By DOUG FERGUSON Â© Warren Little/Getty Images Dottie Pepper of the United States poses for a portrait following the announcement of the 2013 Solheim Cup Europe and USA Teams at The Old Course on August 4, 2013 in St Andrews, Scotland. NAPA, Calif. (AP) Dottie Pepper has joined the CBS Sports golf broadcasting team and will return to full-time work.
AdChoices Pepper will start work next year at Torrey Pines for the Farmers Insurance Open. Her work with CBS on the course and occasionally in a booth also will take her to the Masters and the PGA Championship.
She most recently was working for ESPN, and she became available when ESPN signed over its rights to the British Open one year early to NBC.
CBS Sports Chairman Sean McManus says she will remain with ESPN for the rest of their golf coverage. She becomes the first woman on the CBS broadcast team for PGA Tour events. Pepper was with NBC Sports until leaving in 2012 to reduce her travel schedule
